intro: Stegocedrus, commonly known as the Lebanese cypress, is a genus of coniferous evergreen trees native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Cupressaceae and is characterized by its narrow, conical shape and scale-like leaves. The most well-known species, Stegocedrus libanotis, is often found in rocky soils and mountainous areas. Its wood is aromatic and has been historically used for construction and religious purposes. The plant plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, providing shelter for various wildlife species.
